channel.title: A New Possibility?
channel.description: With technology it is certain that cloning is possible, but think about this: If you were 50 years old and were cloned, then when the clone comes of age a brain transplant is performed and the clones brain is replaced by your brain, would you be able to continue out your life in a younger body, live longer, and have your prior knowledge? Oh well, discuss!

item.title: A New Possibility?
item.dc:creator: @kuiren2 Kuiren
item.description:
@kuiren2 wrote:

Why not take out the dna that controls aging?

Read full topic

Dell451:

No, You see, What you want to to is to have clones of you when you start have promblems, heart , back, spine, whatever, and you want until a little while then your organs get transplanet from theirs, you take their heart, their lung, their kindney, their liver, what ever, and that, my friends is the secret to life!

Just make sure you make them mentally retarded so they can’t rebel

item.title: A New Possibility?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“therealjdb, post:44, topic:69355”][quote author=Uriko link=topic=101895.msg1055013#msg1055013 date=1174959332]

It will NEVER happen, cells would DIE which CANNOT be replaced. Your brain would also DIE because it CANNOT touch the air.

Thanks.

It’s basically just the oxygen. It kills brain cells.
http://www.docguide.com/dg.nsf/PrintPrint/344E8FD6D4B8978E85256683006ABDB7
Might be of some interest, I just skimmed through it.

No! Frankenstein said I’m right! I have also heard of people having their brains frozen, is that not possible?
[/quote]It isn’t possible at this present time, people have actually “donated” their bodies to uhm, what’s that word… researching things I guess? So that in the future they can be revived. But, when you freeze the brain, while defrosting it turns into mush.

When you freeze living/dead cells ice crystals form killing and destroying the remaining cells. ;)[/quote]

Which is why they use glycerin or another “natural antifreeze”.

Read full topic

item.title: A New Possibility?
item.dc:creator: @Hex_Key Hex Key
item.description:
@Hex_Key wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

Well, people get blood transfusions all the time, only this would be an extreme version. You could also use the remaining blood from your former body. And it has to be done quick.

The proteins degrade, you would need a constant supply of newly synthesised proteins. You could ahve a constant blood transfusion but that wouls suck and you may aswell be dead.

Read full topic

item.title: A New Possibility?
item.dc:creator: @Hex_Key Hex Key
item.description:
@Hex_Key wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

Why transplant the brain, if you can transplant the whole head. Just make a mechenical heart, put some things in the main blood thingys so your brain wont die and cut off the head :P. And then do some plastical surgery so your head looks young too.

The blood contains 1000’s of proteins, where would they all be synthesised from if youwer robotic other than just your head?

Read full topic

It will NEVER happen, cells would DIE which CANNOT be replaced. Your brain would also DIE because it CANNOT touch the air.

item.title: A New Possibility?
item.dc:creator: @Hex_Key Hex Key
item.description:
@Hex_Key wrote:

success rate in all procedures increases over time. In the 1800’s the majority of majorsurgerys resulted directly in death, or a post surgery infection that resulted in death. Mortality at the operating table is tiny now.

Read full topic

item.title: A New Possibility?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

But it won’t work with a high enough success rate to interest the majority of the population.

Though it would be cool. Now you have something to do when you kidnap someone. Give me the money, or I’ll take his body. And the gay problem could be solved also. All those gays just get girl bodies and become lesbian. That would be spectacular.

Read full topic
